page.title: 10LOCHGOILHEAD-TRANSPORT(1)
page.content: Lochgoilhead's public transport is limited to a bus service which runs to Arrochar Railway Station twice daily to connect with the Glasgow train.It also runs four times a day to{Carrick {Castle,}our neighbouring village,which stands,six miles away,at the head of Loch Goil.The bus is used to convey the primary school children from Carrick Castle and the west side of the loch to and from school.The bus driver is Barry Cullen but is known to everyone as{Barry the Bus.} Private car is the most common and convenient form of transport. The people are willing to pay,grudgingly perhaps,over Â£2.25 per gallon for petrol.The price of petrol is shared by several people who group together to go shopping in the large towns. The cars are heavily laden with groceries for several weeks.
